result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Plea/sentencing hearing on September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.

11:00 AM Defendant Lee D Lee by Zoom (video), in custody, with attorney Jessica A Klein.   Randy P. Sitzberger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defense requests to quash warrant and reinstate bail.
No objection by the State.
Court orders capias quashed.  Court orders cash bail reinstated.
Defense requests plea and sentencing date.
Clerk to prepare an order to produce the defendant by 9/8/22.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 12, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Letter from Defendant re: Guilty Plea.   **Reviewed by Judge Bohren on June 23, 2022 - Court does not understand the content.** ss
Hearing on June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:42 AM Attorney Jessica A Klein in court.   Defendant Lee D Lee did not appear.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant appears to be on Zoom but the video has not been turned on and the audio has not connected after about 10 minutes.
Defense advises defendant is on hold for other matters as well as this one and requests a further proceedings date.
Defendant to appear by video for the next court date.  Hearing scheduled for June 30, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Bail/bond hearing on June 15, 2022 at 10:30 am.
